meanings.definition: Tuataras: a type of lizard-like reptile found in New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: I saw a tuataras at the zoo yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The tuataras basked in the sun on the rock.
meanings.sent3: The tuataras tried to do a cartwheel but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The tuataras in the exhibit were as still as statues.
meanings.sent5: The tuataras' unique appearance fascinated the visitors.

meanings.definition: Tuataras: plural form of tuatara, referring to more than one individual of the species.
meanings.sent1: The tuataras are the oldest living reptiles on Earth.
meanings.sent2: We observed the tuataras in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The tuataras organized a tea party in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The tuataras stood out in the crowd with their distinctive markings.
meanings.sent5: The tuataras' population is carefully monitored for conservation efforts.
